text_1: Weekends I’m usually out hiking or at a gallery.
text_2: I tend to spend my free time either on trails or looking at art.

text_1: Not really looking for someone who’s super into nightlife.
text_2: I’m hoping to find someone who’s more low-key about going out.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with a lot of drinking.
text_2: Heavy drinking isn’t really my thing—or something I’m okay with in a partner.

text_1: Politics matter to me but I don’t need us to agree on everything.
text_2: We don’t have to see eye to eye on every issue, but I care that we’re coming from a similar place.

text_1: I’ve had pets my whole life and can’t imagine not having one.
text_2: Having animals around is pretty non-negotiable for me.

text_1: Career’s important but so is being present.
text_2: I want to be driven without it swallowing the rest of life.

text_1: I’m not sure I’m cut out for someone who needs a lot of reassurance.
text_2: I tend to do better with people who are fairly secure in themselves.

text_1: I’d rather cook at home than eat out most nights.
text_2: Going out is nice sometimes but I’m more of a home kitchen person.

text_1: Religion isn’t central for me but I respect it mattering to others.
text_2: It’s not a big part of my life, though I get that it is for some people.

text_1: I’m hoping for something that could get serious.
text_2: Not really in a casual phase—looking for something with real potential.

text_1: I need someone who gets that I’m introverted.
text_2: Big crowds drain me; I recharge alone or with one or two people.

text_1: Fitness is part of my routine but I’m not obsessive.
text_2: I work out regularly without it defining my life.

text_1: Kids are probably in the picture someday.
text_2: I think I’d like to have a family eventually.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with smoking.
text_2: Smoking’s a dealbreaker for me, to be honest.

text_1: Travel’s a priority when I can afford it.
text_2: I try to use my time off to see new places.

text_1: We both like live music and trying new restaurants.
text_2: She’s into concerts; he’s always looking up new places to eat.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who’s okay with my schedule.
text_2: My job’s demanding; I need someone who gets that.

text_1: I tend to be pretty direct.
text_2: I’d rather say what I think than dance around it.

text_1: Not big on drama or games.
text_2: I’m looking for something straightforward and calm.

text_1: Family’s important—we don’t have to agree on everything but it matters.
text_2: I’m close to my family and want that to be respected.

text_1: I’m really into running and being outdoors.
text_2: I’m more of a homebody; I like a quiet night in.

text_1: I tend to prioritize my career and work late often.
text_2: I’m hoping to find someone who’s also really driven and ambitious.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with alcohol being a big part of social life.
text_2: I love trying new bars and wine tastings on the weekend.

text_1: I’m hoping to have kids in the next few years.
text_2: I’ve thought about it and I don’t think parenthood is for me.

text_1: I need a lot of alone time to recharge.
text_2: I’m pretty extroverted—I get energy from being around people.

text_1: I’m not really a pet person.
text_2: I’ve always had dogs and can’t imagine life without one.

text_1: I’m looking for something serious and long-term.
text_2: I’m not in a place to commit—just seeing how things go.

text_1: I tend to be pretty frugal and save a lot.
text_2: I like to enjoy my money—travel, nice dinners, experiences.

text_1: Religion’s a big part of how I live.
text_2: I’m not religious and it’s not something I want to bring into a relationship.

text_1: I’m hoping to stay in this city for a long time.
text_2: I’m open to relocating if the right opportunity comes up.

text_1: I like to keep things light and not rush.
text_2: I’m ready to settle down and don’t want to waste time.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with conflict—I’d rather keep the peace.
text_2: I need to talk things through when something’s wrong.

text_1: I’m really close to my family and see them every week.
text_2: I’m pretty independent from my family—we talk but I don’t need that much contact.

text_1: I tend to be spontaneous and last-minute.
text_2: I like to plan ahead and know what’s happening.

text_1: Fitness and health are non-negotiable for me.
text_2: I’m not really into the gym—I’d rather relax.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with smoking—it’s a hard line for me.
text_2: I smoke occasionally when I’m out; it’s not a big deal.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who wants to split things fairly.
text_2: I prefer to take care of the bill—it’s how I was raised.

text_1: I’m not really into the idea of marriage.
text_2: Marriage is something I’ve always wanted.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with drugs—even recreationally.
text_2: I’m open-minded about occasional use in the right setting.

text_1: I’m hoping we’d be on the same page about money.
text_2: I’d rather not merge finances or talk about it much.

text_1: I tend to need a lot of reassurance in relationships.
text_2: I’m pretty secure and don’t need constant validation.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with someone who’s still close with their ex.
text_2: My ex and I co-parent; we’re in touch a lot.

text_1: I’m hoping to find someone who doesn’t smoke.
text_2: I’ve been cutting back but I still have one sometimes when I’m stressed.

text_1: Alcohol isn’t really my thing—I’d prefer it wasn’t a big part of their life either.
text_2: I’m not a heavy drinker but I do enjoy wine with dinner.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with non-monogamy.
text_2: I’ve been exploring open relationships and it’s been interesting.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who wants kids.
text_2: I’m on the fence—leaning no but could be swayed.

text_1: I tend to need someone who’s okay with me traveling for work.
text_2: I get anxious when my partner’s away a lot.

text_1: I’m not really comfortable with someone who’s super active on social media.
text_2: I post a lot—it’s part of my job and my brand.

text_1: I’m hoping we’d want similar things from day-to-day life.
text_2: I like to go out most nights; staying in feels like wasting time.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with a big age gap.
text_2: I’ve dated older and younger; age is just a number to me.

text_1: I’d want someone who’s on the same page about religion.
text_2: I’m spiritual but not in a traditional way.

text_1: I’m not really okay with someone who’s still figuring things out.
text_2: I’m in a transition phase—new job, new city, seeing what sticks.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who doesn’t want to move.
text_2: I might want to try living abroad in a few years.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with someone who’s really into partying.
text_2: I’ve calmed down but I still like a good night out.

text_1: I’d want us to want the same kind of commitment.
text_2: I’ve been hurt before—I need to take things slow.

text_1: I’m not really okay with someone who’s super close to their family.
text_2: My family’s a big part of my life—we talk every day.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who’s done with the dating scene.
text_2: I’m still seeing a few people—not exclusive yet.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with someone who’s really career-focused.
text_2: My career’s my priority right now—probably for a few more years.

text_1: We’re both kind of messy and disorganized.
text_2: I’m pretty tidy; clutter stresses me out.

text_1: I’m not sure how I feel about it yet.
text_2: I’ve thought about it a lot and I’m still not sure.

text_1: I like to keep some things private.
text_2: I value honesty and openness.

text_1: I’m hoping for something real.
text_2: I’m tired of things that don’t go anywhere.

text_1: I tend to go with the flow.
text_2: I like to have a plan.

text_1: I’m not the best at texting back quickly.
text_2: I like to stay in touch throughout the day.

text_1: I’m looking for someone who gets me.
text_2: I want to find someone I can really connect with.

text_1: I’m okay with things being complicated sometimes.
text_2: I prefer to keep things simple.

text_1: I’m not sure what I’m looking for.
text_2: I’m open to seeing what happens.

text_1: I need someone who gives me space.
text_2: I like to feel close but not suffocated.

text_1: I’m pretty independent.
text_2: I like doing things as a team.

text_1: I’m hoping we’d have similar values.
text_2: Values matter to me but I don’t need us to be the same.

text_1: I’m not great with change.
text_2: I’m trying to be more flexible.

text_1: I want someone who’s kind.
text_2: Kindness is really important to me.

text_1: I’m still working on myself.
text_2: I think we’re all a work in progress.

text_1: I like to take things slow.
text_2: I don’t want to rush into anything.

text_1: I’m not sure we’d be compatible.
text_2: We might have different priorities.

text_1: I’m looking for a partner, not a project.
text_2: I’m hoping to grow together.

text_1: I need someone who’s emotionally available.
text_2: I’ve had issues with that in the past.

text_1: I’m pretty low-maintenance.
text_2: I like to put effort in.

text_1: I’m hoping for balance.
text_2: I don’t want things to be one-sided.

text_1: I’m not the most romantic person.
text_2: I show love in different ways.

text_1: I like to talk things through.
text_2: I sometimes need space before I can talk.

text_1: I’m cautious about getting hurt again.
text_2: I’m trying to be more open.

text_1: I want someone who challenges me.
text_2: I like to feel supported.

text_1: I’m not sure I’m ready for something serious.
text_2: I’m open to it if it feels right.

text_1: I tend to overthink.
text_2: I’m more of a go-with-the-gut person.

text_1: I’m hoping we’d make each other laugh.
text_2: A sense of humor is important to me.

text_1: I’m not the best at expressing my feelings.
text_2: I’m working on being more open.

text_1: I like to know where I stand.
text_2: I don’t need constant clarity.

text_1: I’m looking for something that feels easy.
text_2: Good relationships take work.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who’s honest.
text_2: Honesty’s non-negotiable for me.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with too much drama.
text_2: I’ve had enough of that.

text_1: I need someone who’s patient.
text_2: I can be a lot sometimes.

text_1: I’m pretty set in my ways.
text_2: I’m trying to be more adaptable.

text_1: I want someone who’s there for me.
text_2: I want to be there for them too.

text_1: I’m not sure what compatibility even means.
text_2: I think it’s about how you handle the differences.

text_1: I like stability.
text_2: I get bored if things are too predictable.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who’s kind to themselves too.
text_2: Self-care matters to me.

text_1: I’m not the easiest person to date.
text_2: I’m worth it though.

text_1: I need someone who understands my schedule.
text_2: My work’s unpredictable.

text_1: I’m not really into labels.
text_2: I’d rather just see how it goes.

text_1: I’m hoping to find someone who’s okay with my past.
text_2: I have some baggage but I’ve done a lot of work on myself.

text_1: I tend to be pretty guarded at first.
text_2: It takes me a while to open up.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with someone who’s still hung up on an ex.
text_2: I’m over my ex but we’re still in the same friend group.

text_1: I’m really into fitness and nutrition.
text_2: I try to stay active when I can.

text_1: I’m hoping we’d want to live in the same kind of place.
text_2: I’ve always wanted to live in the country.

text_1: I’m not comfortable with someone who’s very political.
text_2: I’m really involved in local politics.

text_1: I like to keep work and life separate.
text_2: I bring work home sometimes—it’s hard to switch off.

text_1: I’m hoping for someone who’s ready to build a life together.
text_2: I’m still figuring out what I want.
